member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_ABOUT_FOGBUGZ
member.summary:
The FB_ABOUT_FOGBUGZ string: "FogBugz is a system that helps you track and fix bugs, talk with your clients, and manage projects.

You can learn more [here].

If you need more in-depth information about FogBugz, please consult [our online help notes], [the FogBugz discussion and support forum].

FogBugz uses icons from the [Silk Icon Set].

FogBugz is a product of [Fog Creek Software]."

member.summary: The FB_ACCEPT string: "Accept"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_ACCESS_DEPRECATED
member.summary: The FB_ACCESS_DEPRECATED string: "As of FogBugz 8.0, support for Microsoft Access is being deprecated."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_ACCESS_DEPRECATED_DETAILS
member.summary: The FB_ACCESS_DEPRECATED_DETAILS string: "We noticed that you're still using Access with your FogBugz install. MS Access works perfectly well with FogBugz 8.0, and we have performed extensive testing against Access. However, in the near future we may be discontinuing support for Access. If and when we decide to do this, we will provide an easy migration path from Access to SQL Server Express for any customers still using Access. [Read more]."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_ACCESS_INSTRUCTIONS
member.summary: The FB_ACCESS_INSTRUCTIONS string: "If you download the Access version, just replace your FogBugz.mdb in the Accessories folder with this file (make sure the FogBugz user has full permissions on this file)."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_AUTOSORT_INSTRUCTIONS
member.summary: The FB_AUTOSORT_INSTRUCTIONS string: "New email will go into this project. FogBugz will try to sort them automatically into areas (Spam, Nonspam, Undecided, or any others you create). If FogBugz makes a mistake, you can train it simply by moving the case to another area. The more you train it, the smarter it gets."

member.summary: The FB_CONFIG_PERFORCE string: "Select the operating system running on your Perforce server. Or, if you have a Windows server that can access your Perforce server, you can use the Perforce Defect Tracking Gateway (DTG) instead of setting up a trigger script. Setting up the DTG is more work, but will show FogBugz cases as Perforce Jobs and allow you to apply changelists to them directly."

member.summary:
The FB_COPY_TRIAL_DB string: "FogBugz will now create a copy of your database for you to download.
You will not be able to create or view cases while the database is being copied.
After the copy is complete and you have downloaded it, you will have the option to restore full access to your FogBugz account."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_COPY_USER_INSTRUCT
member.summary:
The FB_COPY_USER_INSTRUCT string: "

Only one user per line is allowed, each in the following format:

user@example.com,Full Name

Or, you can specify just an email:

user@example.com

"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_COPYRIGHT
member.summary: The FB_COPYRIGHT string: "© Copyright 2000-%1 [Fog Creek Software], Inc. All Rights Reserved."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_CORRECT
member.summary: The FB_CORRECT string: "Correct"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_CORRECT_DATABASE_1
member.summary:
The FB_CORRECT_DATABASE_1 string: "

For security reasons, this cannot be fixed over the web.

Please edit the registry on the FogBugz server. The setting you want is "

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_CORRECT_DATABASE_2
member.summary:
The FB_CORRECT_DATABASE_2 string: "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Fog Creek Software\FogBugz\%1\sConnectionString.
Common connection strings can be found at [connectionstrings.com]. (Also please note that if your SQL machine is on a different server than your web server, you may have to [use SQL Server Authentication, and not Integrated Authentication].)

To use SQL Server, set this to "

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_CORRECT_DATABASE_3
member.summary:
The FB_CORRECT_DATABASE_3 string: "Server=server;Initial Catalog=database;MultipleActiveResultSets=true;Integrated Security=SSPI; for Integrated Authentication
or Server=server;Initial Catalog=database;MultipleActiveResultSets=true;User Id=sqlserveruser;Password=sqlserverpassword; for SQL Server Authentication

"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_CORRECT_DATABASE_4
member.summary: The FB_CORRECT_DATABASE_4 string: "To use Access, set this to Provider=Microsoft.Jet.OLEDB.4.0;Data Source=filename"

member.summary: The FB_CVS string: "CVS"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_CVS_DIFF_TIP
member.summary:
The FB_CVS_DIFF_TIP string: "For [integration with your source code control system], enter the URL that shows the differences between two versions of a file.
^FILE will be replaced with the file name.
^R1 will be replaced with the old version number.
^R2 will be replaced with the new version number.
Examples:
CVSweb: http://.../cvsweb/cvsweb.cgi^FILE?r1=^R1&r2=^R2
WebSVN: http://.../subversion/diff.php?rep=0&path=^FILE&rev=^R2&sc=1
Vault: http://.../VaultService/VaultWeb/VaultDiff.aspx?File=^FILE&Object=^R1&Version=^R2
Perforce (Changelist): http://...:8080/@md=d&cd=//&c=6fI@/^R2?ac=10
Perforce (Files): http://...:8080/@md=d&cdf=^FILE&ra=s&c=@^FILE?ac=19&rev1=^R1&rev2=^R2
VSS: http://your.fogbugz.server/default.asp?pg=pgShowVSSFileDiff&FILE=^FILE&R1=^R1&R2=^R2
VSS ([Remoting]): https://.../diff.srf?target=^FILE&v1=^R1&v2=^R2
TFS (with Team System Web Access 2008): http://...:8090/diff.aspx?opath=^FILE&ocs=^R1&mpath=^FILE&mcs=^R2"

member.summary:
The FB_CVS_DIFF_TIP_HOSTED string: "For [integration with your source code control system], enter the URL that shows the differences between two versions of a file.
^FILE will be replaced with the file name.
^R1 will be replaced with the old version number.
^R2 will be replaced with the new version number.
Examples:

WebSVN: http://.../subversion/diff.php?rep=0&path=^FILE&rev=^R2&sc=1
Perforce (Changelist): http://...:8080/@md=d&cd=//&c=6fI@/^R2?ac=10
Perforce (Files): http://...:8080/@md=d&cdf=^FILE&ra=s&c=@^FILE?ac=19&rev1=^R1&rev2=^R2
VSS: http://your.fogbugz.server/default.asp?pg=pgShowVSSFileDiff&FILE=^FILE&R1=^R1&R2=^R2

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_CVS_INSTRUCTIONS
member.summary: The FB_CVS_INSTRUCTIONS string: "Check out the CVSROOT directory. Download the following script, put it into the working copy checkout of CVSROOT, and <tt>cvs add</tt> it."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_CVS_INSTRUCTIONS_2
member.summary:
The FB_CVS_INSTRUCTIONS_2 string: "Add the following line to the end of the loginfo file:
ALL cscript.exe $CVSROOT\CVSROOT\logBugData.vbs "${sVv}"
Add the following line to the end of the checkoutlist file:
logBugData.vbs Error-logBugData.vbs
Check in your changes with
# cvs commit
[More Information]"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_CVS_INSTRUCTIONS_UNIX
member.summary: The FB_CVS_INSTRUCTIONS_UNIX string: "Check out the CVSROOT directory. Download the following script and make it executable with <tt>chmod +x logBugData.pl</tt>. Then put it into the working copy checkout of CVSROOT and <tt>cvs add</tt> it."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_CVS_INSTRUCTIONS_UNIX_2
member.summary:
The FB_CVS_INSTRUCTIONS_UNIX_2 string: "Add the following line to the end of the loginfo file:
ALL perl -s $CVSROOT\CVSROOT\logBugData.pl "${sVv}"
Add the following line to the end of the checkoutlist file:
logBugData.pl Error-logBugData.pl
Check in your changes with
# cvs commit
[More Information]"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_DEMO_NO_MAILBOX_SCREEN
member.summary: The FB_DEMO_NO_MAILBOX_SCREEN string: "The trial version of FogBugz only allows you to have one mailbox ( %1 ) which is automatically specified to put all incoming messages into the 'Incoming Email' project. In the purchased version, you can have as many mailboxes as you like, and set them each up to go into their own project, area, milestone, priority, and assignee. You can even set a template that appears when you respond to messages in any of the mailboxes (such as a signature)."

member.summary: The FB_DISCUSS_DAYSHOMEPAGE_INSTRUCT string: "A number determining how many days worth of topics will be listed on the main page. For busy discussion groups, use a low number like 7 to keep the main page manageable. For new discussion groups, 30 is a good start. Anything older than this number of days will disappear from the main page (although it will still be visible in the archive)."

member.summary: The FB_DISPATCHO_ERROR_IMPORTING_MAIL string: "Mail Import Failure. Unknown error during mail import from mailbox %1 on server %2. (Error Msg returned '%3'). FogBugz will continue trying to import mail. You may delete this notification, but if it continues to occur you should use Outlook Express or another mail client to examine the message on the server. It may be too large, malformed, no space left in your FogBugz database, etc."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_EMAIL_INSTRUCTIONS
member.summary:
The FB_EMAIL_INSTRUCTIONS string: "There are cases that need your attention in FogBugz. To check these cases: - Go to %1 - If you are not already logged on, click to log on - Click on the 'Show Me My Cases' link or enter the case numbers in the search box
Remember, if a case that you opened has been resolved, you still need to check that the resolution is OK and close the case.
If you need any help or if you don't know why you got this message, please contact me."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_ERROR_CRYPTO_BROKEN
member.summary:
The FB_ERROR_CRYPTO_BROKEN string: "** Unable To Verify License Information **

FogBugz was unable to verify the license information. This is usually because FogBugz does not have permission to access the Microsoft Cryptography store.

To correct this:

(1) Determine which account FogBugz is running under. In IIS, check the account used for anonymous access.
(2) If your server is Windows 2000 or later, grant full access for this account on the following directory: c:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Application Data\Microsoft\Crypto\RSA
(3) If your server is Windows NT 4.0, run REGEDT32 and grant permission for this account to access the registry key at HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Cryptography\MachineKeys.
"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_ERROR_PARENT_PATHS_DISABLED_FIX
member.summary:
The FB_ERROR_PARENT_PATHS_DISABLED_FIX string: "Before you continue, you must enable parent paths in IIS.  Follow these steps and then refresh this page to begin using FogBugz.

1) Click Start and open 'Control Panel'.
2) Open 'Administrative Tools'.
3) Open 'Internet Information Services'.
4) Expand your local computer directory, and expand the 'Web Sites' folder.
5) Right-click on 'FogBugz' and select properties.
6) Under the 'Home Directory' or 'Virtual Directory' tab, click 'Configuration'.
7) Under the 'Options' tab, check 'Enable parent paths'.
"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_ERROR_WMI_ACCESS_DENIED
member.summary:
The FB_ERROR_WMI_ACCESS_DENIED string: "

FogBugz does not have permission to access the Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI). To add the required permission:

  1. Go to Start > Run and enter "wmimgmt.msc"
  2. Go to Action > Properties
  3. Select the Security tab
  4. Expand Root and select CIMV2 and click Security
  5. Add the FogBugz user to the list of users and check "Allow" for "Enable Account"
  6. Click OK > OK to close all windows and apply the settings.
"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_ESTIMATE_HISTORY_EXPLANATION
member.summary: The FB_ESTIMATE_HISTORY_EXPLANATION string: "In order to be considered a historical estimate for a user, a case must be estimated by that user, have time charged against it, and then be resolved and closed. The resolution must be "Completed", "Fixed", "Implemented", or "Responded.""

member.summary: The FB_EXPLAIN_DAILY_SCHEDULE string: "If this is checked, FogBugz will stop and start the clock automatically when you are working on a feature. For example, if your daily schedule goes from 9am to 5pm, and you start working on a case at 4pm, FogBugz will assume that you went home at 5pm and stopped working on that case until the next morning at 9am. You can always override this in the timesheet."

member.summary: The FB_EXPLAIN_DELETING_PEOPLE string: "You can't delete people, because a complete history needs to be maintained. Instead, mark them inactive here. They will not be able to log on and they will not count against your license."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_GROUP_ADMIN_NOTE
member.summary: The FB_GROUP_ADMIN_NOTE string: "Group Administrators are able to modify all aspects of %1 including creating and deleting projects and user permissions. Only Site Administrators are able to create and delete %2."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_GROUP_BACKFILL_CHANGES_EXPLANATION
member.summary:
The FB_GROUP_BACKFILL_CHANGES_EXPLANATION string: "In order to improve the permissions system in FogBugz, we have changed the way permission groups are managed. In particular, users no longer have permissions based on groups, but instead get permission on projects either directly from the project or through membership in a group.

To avoid modifying your permissions, new groups have been created from your original groups. Users from old groups were placed in corresponding new groups based on their permission level. For example, someone who had modify permission on group "A" would be placed in the new group "A (Write)". If a new group would have had only one member, then it was not created and the member was given appropriate permissions directly.

Note that, while the group management system has changed, all permissions are exactly the same as they were before the upgrade."

member.summary: The FB_GROUP_BACKFILL_DISMISS string: "Dismiss"

member.summary: The FB_GROUP_BACKFILL_GROUPS_MODIFIED string: "Your Groups Have Been Modified."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_GROUP_BACKFILL_HIDE_GROUPS
member.summary: The FB_GROUP_BACKFILL_HIDE_GROUPS string: "Hide Groups"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_GROUP_BACKFILL_INSTRUCTIONS
member.summary:
The FB_GROUP_BACKFILL_INSTRUCTIONS string: "

As part of the permissions upgrade, the users below no longer have the ability to create new projects, wikis, and discussion groups. They can also no longer set permissions for users. If some or all of the users in the list below need to perform these functions, please click the "Promote" link to promote them to full site administrator.

Site administrators can perform all administrative functions in FogBugz, including managing permissions, adding or deleting users, and modifying the overall site configuration.

If you have concerns about this change, feel free to [contact us.]

"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_HOSTED_ADITIONAL_ADMIN_INTRO
member.summary:
The FB_HOSTED_ADITIONAL_ADMIN_INTRO string: "Hi!
%1 (%2) has created a %3 site for you so you can use Fog Creek Software's bug tracking and project management system called FogBugz.
Just a few things to note as you're getting started:"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_HOSTED_ADITIONAL_ADMIN_INTRO_KILN
member.summary:
The FB_HOSTED_ADITIONAL_ADMIN_INTRO_KILN string: "Hi!
%1 (%2) has created a %3 site for you so you can use Fog Creek Software's complete version control system called Kiln.
Just a few things to note as you're getting started:"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_HOSTED_ADITIONAL_ADMIN_WELCOME_EMAIL
member.summary:
The FB_HOSTED_ADITIONAL_ADMIN_WELCOME_EMAIL string: "%1
1) LOGGING ON
Use this link to choose your password and log on to your FogBugz site:
%3
Your site's URL is:
%4
2) YOUR ACCOUNT
Your %2 account starts with a free 45-day trial period. This period will end on %5. During your trial, we will send you a few emails to remind you of this expiration date. You can check the status of your account at any time and make any necessary changes on the "Your Account" page:
%6
3) YOUR DATA
You can easily download your FogBugz site's data in SQL Server, MySQL, or Access format at any time. Just visit the "Your Account" page linked to above.
4) JOEL ON BUG TRACKING
Bug tracking is a critical part of software project management. Here's an interesting (and funny!) article by Joel Spolsky called Painless Bug tracking at Joel on Software, with all kinds of helpful tips:
http://www.joelonsoftware.com/articles/fog0000000029.html
5) THE FOG CREEK DEVELOPMENT BUNDLE
Every new On Demand account starts you out with a 45-day free trial of the Fog Creek Development. That means you get a no-risk free trial of the awesome integration between Kiln and FogBugz, not to mention all of the other great features Kiln has to offer: a complete version control system and seamlessly integrated code review. More information about your free trial period and the Fog Creek Development Bundle can be found in the "Your Plan" section on "Your Account" page:
%6
The best part is that you save 40% on your total bill with the bundle. That's a lot of power for about $5 more per user per month.
If you have any questions or if there's any way we can be of assistance, please do not hesitate to reply to this email.
Best wishes,
-- Fog Creek Customer Service customer-service@fogcreek.com"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_HOSTED_ADITIONAL_ADMIN_WELCOME_EMAIL_KILN
member.summary:
The FB_HOSTED_ADITIONAL_ADMIN_WELCOME_EMAIL_KILN string: "%1
1) LOGGING ON
Use this link to choose your password and log on to your Kiln site:
%3
Your site's URL is:
%4
2) YOUR ACCOUNT
Your %2 account starts with a free 45-day trial period. This period will end on %5. During your trial, we will send you a few emails to remind you of this expiration date. You can check the status of your account at any time and make any necessary changes on the "Your Account" page:
%6
3) YOUR CODE
Your code is securely stored on our servers and backed up regularly. You can read all about our secure data centers here:
http://www.fogcreek.com/Kiln/OnDemandInfrastructure.html
On top of that, when you clone a Kiln repository you get an exact copy of it (including all of the history). In other words, you are creating a backup of your code every time you work on your repositories.
4) BEST PRACTICES
Kiln and Mercurial give you all sorts of power and flexibility. To read about best practices and get answers to all your questions, take a look at the Kiln StackExchange:
http://kiln.stackexchange.com
5) THE FOG CREEK DEVELOPMENT BUNDLE
Every new On Demand account starts you out with a 45-day free trial of the Fog Creek Development Bundle. That means you get a no-risk free trial of the awesome integration between Kiln and FogBugz, not to mention all of the other great features FogBugz has to offer (e.g. project planning, issue-tracking, and wikis). More information about your free trial period and the Fog Creek Development Bundle can be found in the "Your Plan" section on "Your Account" page
%6
The best part is that you save 40% on your total bill with the bundle. That's a lot of power for about $5 more per user per month.
If you have any questions or if there's any way we can be of assistance, please do not hesitate to reply to this email.
Best wishes,
-- Fog Creek Customer Service customer-service@fogcreek.com"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_HOSTED_PRIMARY_WELCOME_EMAIL
member.summary:
The FB_HOSTED_PRIMARY_WELCOME_EMAIL string: "Dear %1,
Thank you for signing up for %2! Your site has been created and is ready to be used:
%3
Just a few things to note as you're getting started:
1) YOUR ACCOUNT
Your %2 account starts with a free 45-day trial period. This period will end on %4. During your trial, we will send you a few emails to remind you of this expiration date. You can check the status of your account at any time and make any necessary changes on the "Your Account" page:
%5
2) YOUR DATA
You can easily download your FogBugz site's data in SQL Server, MySQL, or Access format at any time. Just visit the "Your Account" page linked to above.
3) YOUR PASSWORD
If you ever forget your password, just click the "Forgot password" link below the login box on your site's front page. Or, you can always follow this link:
%6
4) JOEL ON BUG TRACKING
Bug tracking is a critical part of software project management. Here's an interesting (and funny!) article by Joel Spolsky called Painless Bug tracking at Joel on Software, with all kinds of helpful tips:
http://www.joelonsoftware.com/articles/fog0000000029.html
5) THE FOG CREEK DEVELOPMENT BUNDLE
Every new On Demand account starts you out with a 45-day free trial of the Fog Creek Development. That means you get a no-risk free trial of the awesome integration between Kiln and FogBugz, not to mention all of the other great features Kiln has to offer: a complete version control system and seamlessly integrated code review. More information about your free trial period and the Fog Creek Development Bundle can be found in the "Your Plan" section on "Your Account" page:
%5
The best part is that you save 40% on your total bill with the bundle. That's a lot of power for about $5 more per user per month.
If you have any questions or if there's any way we can be of assistance, please do not hesitate to reply to this email.
Best wishes,
-- Fog Creek Customer Service customer-service@fogcreek.com"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_INTRO_SNIPPETS
member.summary:
The FB_INTRO_SNIPPETS string: "Snippets make it easy to type common phrases, sentences, even entire letters, so you can reply to frequently-asked questions in a few keystrokes: just type the snippet name followed by the %1 key.
[Personal snippets] allow you to make your own.

For example, if ty is a snippet for 'Thank you', then typing ty%1 would be replaced with 'Thank you'."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_INVALID_CATEGORY_RESET_TO
member.summary: The FB_INVALID_CATEGORY_RESET_TO string: "FogBugz detected that Case %1's category was incorrectly set to '%2' (ixCategory = %3), and FogBugz has reset the category to '%4' (ixCategory = %5). This was most likely caused by something external to FogBugz, such as a plugin."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_INVALID_DATABASE
member.summary:
The FB_INVALID_DATABASE string: "You do not have a version of the FogBugz database that FogBugz could read.  It is possible that restarting your web server will reset things back to normal.  If you are trying to get FogBugz to create a blank database for you, please add a table named Version with a column named ixVersion (int) and the value 0 in it.

Please backup your data and reinstall FogBugz."

member.summary:
The FB_INVALID_STATUS_CHANGE_HELP string: "FogBugz was instructed via a Plugin or the XML API to set Case {0}'s status from '{1}' (ixStatus = {2}) to '{3}' (ixStatus = {4}), which is not a valid status within category '{5}'. The status has been reset to '{6}' (ixStatus = {7}). Status {4} is meant for cases within category '{8}'.
Debug information: BugAction = {9} Stack trace: {10}"

member.summary:
The FB_LICENSE_OFFLINE_INSTRUCTIONS string: "If you cannot receive your license online because of firewall issues or some other configuration, please email [Fog Creek Software] with the following information:
  • The order number from your FogBugz purchase
  • The email address you used to purchase FogBugz
  • Your computer name and machine ID (see below)

We will send you a license and signature which you can paste into this form.

"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_MERCURIAL
member.summary: The FB_MERCURIAL string: "Mercurial"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_MERCURIAL_INSTRUCTIONS
member.summary:
The FB_MERCURIAL_INSTRUCTIONS string: "

Mercurial repositories are created for you automatically when you enable integration from within Mercurial.

Download this script and place it anywhere that's visible to the Mercurial server process. It should Not be in your hgext directory.

"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_MERCURIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_2
member.summary:
The FB_MERCURIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_2 string: "Add these lines to the .hg/hgrc file in the repository:
[hooks]
changegroup = python:/path/to/fogbugz.py:hook
[fogbugz]
host = %1
[web]
baseurl = http://path/where/repo/is/on/web
The only odd one there is baseurl, which is the web URL to where the "hg serve" web server is running for the provided repository. If you do not have hg serve running, then although FogBugz will record changesets, the links back from FogBugz will not point anywhere meaningful.

Tip: you can follow these steps for multiple Mercurial repositories, and FogBugz will track each one.

After your first checkin, the Mercurial repository will appear here automatically. %2

"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_MERCURIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_DOCS
member.summary: The FB_MERCURIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_DOCS string: "[See the documentation] for more information."

member.summary: The FB_MERGE_FINAL_VERSION string: "Final Version ([Save and use this version])"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_NEW_COMMUNITY_ACCOUNT_BODY
member.summary:
The FB_NEW_COMMUNITY_ACCOUNT_BODY string: "A new FogBugz community account has been created for you. Please confirm your account by visiting the URL below and logging in to FogBugz: %1
Username: %2 Password: %3
If you do not log in within the next %4 hours, your account will be removed.
We assigned you the temporary password above. You may change it once you log in.
-- FogBugz Community Accounts "

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_NEW_COMMUNITY_ACCOUNT_BODY_NO_PASSWORDS
member.summary:
The FB_NEW_COMMUNITY_ACCOUNT_BODY_NO_PASSWORDS string: "A new FogBugz community account has been created for you. Visit the URL below to log in to FogBugz: %1
Username: %2 Password: %3
If you do not log in within the next %4 hours, your account will be removed.
We assigned you the temporary password above. Passwords are not currently required to log in to FogBugz, but you may need yours later. You may change it once you log in.
-- FogBugz Community Accounts"

member.summary: The FB_PASSWORD_POLICY string: "Password Policy"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_PASSWORD_POLICY_RULES
member.summary:
The FB_PASSWORD_POLICY_RULES string: "The Strict Password Policy will enforce the following rules whenever a password is set:
  Passwords must be at least 8 characters long
  Passwords must contain:
    At least 1 uppercase letter
    At least 1 lowercase letter
    At least 1 number
    At least 1 special character (@,#,$,etc.)

If disabled, passwords are only required to be at least 6 characters long."

member.summary: The FB_PERCENT_TIME_EXAMPLE string: "Example: you spend about 1/4 of your time working on your killer plugin, 1/4 of your time in meetings, and 1/2 of your time working on releases of your company's major products; so you enter 25% on Killer Plugin and 50% on All Other FogBugz Tasks. Now FogBugz will "protect" your time by calculating completion dates for your Killer Plugin at 25% of your working time and completion dates for all other projects at 50% of your working time."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_PLACEHOLDERS
member.summary:
The FB_PLACEHOLDERS string: "

Use:
{case} for the case ID
{sender} for the sender's email address
{subject} for the subject of the message
{ticket} for the external customer ID (will also display other cases submitted by the same correspondent)
{ticket_singlecase} for the external customer ID (will *not* display other cases submitted by the same correspondent)
{url} for the URL of the FogBugz install
{ticketurl} for a link to the external case (e.g. %1/default.asp?{ticket})
{fullname} for the fullname associated with this mailbox
{email} for the email associated with this mailbox
{username} for the name of the logged on user
{useremail} for the email of the logged on user

"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_PLACEHOLDERS_AUTOREPLY
member.summary:
The FB_PLACEHOLDERS_AUTOREPLY string: "

Use:
{case} for the case ID
{sender} for the sender's email address
{subject} for the subject of the message
{ticket} for the external customer ID (will also display other cases submitted by the same correspondent)
{ticket_singlecase} for the external customer ID (will *not* display other cases submitted by the same correspondent)
{url} for the URL of the FogBugz install
{ticketurl} for a link to the external case that will also display other cases submitted by the same correspondent (e.g. %1/default.asp?{ticket})
{ticketurl_singlecase} for a link to the external case that will *not* display other cases submitted by the same correspondent (e.g. %1/default.asp?{ticket_singlecase})
{fullname} for the fullname associated with this mailbox
{email} for the email associated with this mailbox

"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_PLACEHOLDERS_SNIPPETS
member.summary:
The FB_PLACEHOLDERS_SNIPPETS string: "

Use:
{case} for the case ID
{sender} for the sender's email address
{subject} for the subject of the message
{ticket} for the external ticket ID (will also display other cases submitted by the same correspondent)
{ticket_singlecase} for the external ticket ID (will *not* display other cases submitted by the same correspondent)
{url} for the URL of the FogBugz install
{ticketurl} for a link to the external case that will also display other cases submitted by the same correspondent (e.g. %1/default.asp?{ticket})
{ticketurl_singlecase} for a link to the external case that will *not* display other cases submitted by the same correspondent (e.g. %1/default.asp?{ticket_singlecase})
{username} for the name of the logged on user
{useremail} for the email of the logged on user

"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_RELEASE_NOTES_INFO
member.summary:
The FB_RELEASE_NOTES_INFO string: "

FogBugz allows you to add a release note to any case, so that when you make a new release, you can prepare a list of all the new features and fixed bugs.

Choose milestones from the table to see a list of all resolved cases from those milestones, then click the Edit icon to add a note for each case. Then click on the XML or HTML links to compile the list of the release notes as a single file, which you can format and distribute to your customers.

"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_SEARCH_DOTNET2_NOT_INSTALLED
member.summary:
The FB_SEARCH_DOTNET2_NOT_INSTALLED string: "

FogBugz Search cannot run, because Microsoft .NET 2.0 or later is not installed.

Please install .NET and make sure that the file FogCreek.Search.DLL is present in the FogBugz\Website\bin directory. Then reload this page.

If this does not correct the problem, please run FogBugz SETUP again.

"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_SEARCH_MONO_NOT_INSTALLED
member.summary:
The FB_SEARCH_MONO_NOT_INSTALLED string: "

FogBugz Search cannot run, because Mono 1.2.3 or later can not be found. Please make sure that it is installed and in the path of the user under whom Apache runs.

After Mono is installed and can be found by Apache, please check that the file FogCreek.Search.DLL ais present in the FogBugz\Website\bin directory.

If this does not correct the problem, please run FogBugz SETUP again.

"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_SEARCH_MYSQL_ENABLE_TRANSACTIONS
member.summary: The FB_SEARCH_MYSQL_ENABLE_TRANSACTIONS string: "You must enable transactions in your MySQL connection in order for FogBugz Search to work properly. If you are using a named DSN, please uncheck the "Disable Transactions" box in the DSN configuration tool, under the 'Advanced' tab, 'Flags 3'. If you are using an ODBC string to connect, please make sure that OPTION=16387 is the option set within the string on the FogBugz site configuration page. Finally, reset the FogBugz searcher in the 'Search' tab on the FogBugz 'Site' page."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_SEARCH_NOT_CONFIGURED_CORRECTLY
member.summary:
The FB_SEARCH_NOT_CONFIGURED_CORRECTLY string: "

FogBugz Search cannot run, because the file FogCreek.Search.DLL is missing.

Please make sure that FogCreek.Search.DLL is present in the FogBugz\Website\bin directory. Then reload this page.

If this does not correct the problem, please run FogBugz SETUP again.

"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_SEARCH_TIPS
member.summary: The FB_SEARCH_TIPS string: "FogBugz search is easy. apple peach searches for both apple and peach. apple OR peach searches for either apple or peach. apple -peach searches for apple and not peach."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_SEARCH_TIPS_ADVANCED_INTRO
member.summary:
The FB_SEARCH_TIPS_ADVANCED_INTRO string: "

You can also use search axes to perform advanced searches. A search axis can be formed from the title of any column in the grid view by removing the spaces. For example, the "Assigned To" column becomes the assignedto: axis such that you could search for assignedto:joel. To find all the cases that Jane resolved last month, resolvedby:jane resolved:"last month". Support cases due tomorrow can be found with the query area:support due:tomorrow. To find cases John Doe opened with the word "widget" in them, search for openedby:"john doe" widget.

For more information about search axes, please consult the %1

"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_SMTP_ERROR
member.summary: The FB_SMTP_ERROR string: "A message could not be sent from your mail queue:"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_SMTP_ERROR_AUTHENTICATION
member.summary:
The FB_SMTP_ERROR_AUTHENTICATION string: "A message could not be sent from your mail queue, because of an authentication problem. It may be because the server requires SSL to be enabled, or because of an invalid username and password. Please check your [SMTP settings here].
Error: %1"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_SMTP_ERROR_BADMAIL
member.summary:
The FB_SMTP_ERROR_BADMAIL string: "A message could not be sent from your mail queue. This is usually because your SMTP server is not set up for relaying. You can permanently delete this message and remove it from the queue by [clicking here]. If you cannot send any mail, try running through the FogBugz diagnostics at (your FogBugz install)/diagnostics.asp.
Error: %1
Headers from the email: %2 "

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_SMTP_ERROR_BADMAIL_HOSTED
member.summary:
The FB_SMTP_ERROR_BADMAIL_HOSTED string: "A message could not be sent from your mail queue. This is usually because of a bad email address in the 'To:' field. You can permanently delete this message and remove it from the queue by [clicking here].
Error: %1
Headers from the email: %2 "

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_SMTP_ERROR_LOGIN
member.summary: The FB_SMTP_ERROR_LOGIN string: "Could not log in to the SMTP server at %1 (check that the username and password are correct if your server requires them - username: %2)"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_SMTP_ERROR_LOGOUT
member.summary: The FB_SMTP_ERROR_LOGOUT string: "Error logging out of the SMTP server. Sometimes this can be caused by a bad login name or password to your SMTP server. Please check your [SMTP settings here]."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_SMTP_ERROR_MAILBOX
member.summary:
The FB_SMTP_ERROR_MAILBOX string: "Some of the recipients of this message do not exist, so the message could not be delivered to them. The other recipients will receive the message.
Error: %1
Headers from the email: %2 "

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_SMTP_ERROR_SSL_CERT
member.summary:
The FB_SMTP_ERROR_SSL_CERT string: "Authentication failed because of an invalid SSL certificate. This may be because the root certificate is not installed, or it is for a different site than you are connecting to, or the certificate is expired or self-signed (issuer is the same as the site). Check the certficate issued by the server and make sure that the root certificate is installed on the FogBugz server. You can also disable SSL in the [settings].
Error: %1
Server Address: %2
Certificate Issued To: %3 Certificate Issuer: %4 Certificate Expiration: %5"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_SMTP_ERROR_SSL_TIMEOUT
member.summary:
The FB_SMTP_ERROR_SSL_TIMEOUT string: "A message could not be sent from your mail queue. This may be because the server expects an implicit SSL connection (typically port 465) which FogBugz does not support. You can try disabling SSL, or connecting using SSL on a standard SMTP port (25 or 587). You can permanently delete this message and remove it from the queue by [clicking here].
Error: %1
Headers from the email: %2"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_SOURCE_CONTROL_KILN_INFO
member.summary: The FB_SOURCE_CONTROL_KILN_INFO string: "Kiln is enabled and adds fully integrated source control hosting to your FogBugz installation. Kiln links checkins with cases, provides code reviews, and gives you a place to safely store all of your code -- without any messy configuration. You don't have to do anything on this page, just get started with your Kiln installation at [%1] or [read more here]."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_SOURCE_CONTROL_KILN_TEASER
member.summary: The FB_SOURCE_CONTROL_KILN_TEASER string: "New source control product announcement! Fog Creek offers a complete version control system based on Mercurial, called [Kiln]. Kiln links checkins with cases, provides code reviews, and gives you a place to safely store all of your code -- without any messy configuration. FogBugz users also receive a steep discount. Learn more at [http://fogcreek.com/kiln]."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_SURE_YOU_WANT_TRIAL
member.summary:
The FB_SURE_YOU_WANT_TRIAL string: "

The database you are about to download is in FogBugz %1 format. You will not be able to use it with previous versions of FogBugz.

To begin, click the 'Download' link. Please be patient as the download process can take several minutes.

If you get a browser prompt asking if you want to 'Open' or 'Save' the file, choose 'Save to disk'.

"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_SVN_INSTRUCTIONS
member.summary: The FB_SVN_INSTRUCTIONS string: "Download these two scripts and place them in the "hooks" subdirectory of your Subversion repository on the server. If you already have a post-commit script, merge it with this one. [More Information]"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_SVN_INSTRUCTIONS_UNIX
member.summary: The FB_SVN_INSTRUCTIONS_UNIX string: "Download these two scripts and place them in the "hooks" subdirectory of your Subversion repository on the server. Make both executable by running <tt>chmod +x post-commit logBugDataSVN.pl</tt>. If you already have a post-commit script, merge it with this one. [More Information]"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_TEMPLATE_CSS_DETAILS
member.summary:
The FB_TEMPLATE_CSS_DETAILS string: "You can control the style options in your wiki's WYSIWYG editor by modifying the CSS above.

For example:
Adding "span.MyFontFamily { font-family: My Custom Font, serif }" will add a "My Font Family" option to the wiki editor's Font dropdown.
Adding "span.AlmostInvisibleSize { font-size: 2px }" will add an "Almost Invisible Size" option to the wiki editor's Font Size dropdown.
Adding "p.Emphasized { color: yellow; padding: 20px; }" will add an "Emphasized" option to the wiki editor's Paragraph/Block dropdown.
Adding "h1.Green { color: green; }" will add a new Heading 1 "Green" option to the wiki editor's Paragraph/Block dropdown.

Palette colors and Table styles can be customized in the same manner. Just follow the examples above."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_TRIAL_DONE
member.summary:
The FB_TRIAL_DONE string: "

When you click 'OK', we will email a password for each of these accounts to the appropriate address and you'll be able to log in.

Due to overwhelming demand, there is currently a waiting list for FogBugz trials. It may take up to 72 hours for the email to be sent and your trial to begin.

"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_TRIAL_EMAIL_BUG_TRACKING_TEASER
member.summary: The FB_TRIAL_EMAIL_BUG_TRACKING_TEASER string: " To learn about bug tracking in general, there's an interesting (and funny!) article by Joel Spolsky called Painless Bug Tracking (http://www.joelonsoftware.com/articles/fog0000000029.html) at Joel on Software, with all kinds of helpful tips. "

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_TRIAL_EMAIL_CHANGE_ANYTIME

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_TRIAL_EMAIL_CONCLUSION
member.summary:
The FB_TRIAL_EMAIL_CONCLUSION string: "Your %2 account starts with a free 45-day trial period. This period will end on %1. During your trial, we will send you a few emails to remind you of this expiration date. You can check the status of your account at any time and make changes to your account on the "Your Account" page. %3 If you have any questions or there's any way we can be of assistance, please do not hesitate to reply to this email.
Best wishes,
-- Fog Creek Customer Service customer-service@fogcreek.com"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_TRIAL_EXPIRED
member.summary:
The FB_TRIAL_EXPIRED string: "

Thank you for trying out FogBugz. Your free trial period has now expired.

Buy FogBugz now from the Fog Creek Online Store, and install it on your own server in minutes!

The Fog Creek Promise: If you're not satisfied for any reason within 90 days you get a full refund, period, no questions asked. We don't want your money if you're not amazingly happy.

"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_TRIAL_HAS_NOT_STARTED
member.summary: The FB_TRIAL_HAS_NOT_STARTED string: "Due to overwhelming demand, after creating your trial you may have to wait up to 72 hours for it to begin.  Your FogBugz trial has not started yet, but you will be notified by email shortly when you reach the front of the waiting list."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_TRIAL_INTRO_NO_DB
member.summary: The FB_TRIAL_INTRO_NO_DB string: "All of the functionality of FogBugz is available in our online demo here for you to try. Nothing to download! If you still wish to test out the install procedure, we encourage you to buy a single license of FogBugz and test it out. We offer a 90 day money back guarantee, so there is no risk to you!"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_TRIAL_SETUP
member.summary:
The FB_TRIAL_SETUP string: "

Set up your trial database

First, bookmark this page, so you can get back to your private database.

Next, we'll create administrator accounts. FogBugz administrators have full control over the database. Please provide an accurate email address because we will email each administrator their password.

"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_TRIAL_SETUP_MISSING
member.summary:
The FB_TRIAL_SETUP_MISSING string: "

Please fill out the missing information highlighted below to set up your database.

"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_TRIAL_SITE_CONFIGURE
member.summary: The FB_TRIAL_SITE_CONFIGURE string: "Due to the shared nature of the trial server, some site-wide configurations for FogBugz are not supported in this trial version. However, you are allowed to begin customizing your trial by doing such things as [configuring source control integration] and [configuring your working schedule].  If you purchase FogBugz, you will be able to use this page to [submit bugs automatically from your programs] and perform further customizations. You can read more about [these features in the help file], or [purchase FogBugz] now to get started using them right away."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_TRIAL_THANK_YOU
member.summary: The FB_TRIAL_THANK_YOU string: "Thank you for creating your trial. Please check your mailbox for an email from fogbugz@fogcreek.com with logon instructions. During peak times, it can take up to 72 hours for this email to arrive."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_TRIAL_WELCOME
member.summary:
The FB_TRIAL_WELCOME string: "

Thank you for trying FogBugz.

We've created a private, empty bug tracking database for you and your team.

Feel free to enter real data. If you purchase FogBugz and install it on your own server, you can download this trial data.

For the next 45 days, your private FogBugz database will be at the following personalized URL:

"

member.summary: The FB_WIKI_IMPORT_CONFLUENCE string: "Confluence"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_WIKI_IMPORT_CONFLUENCE_STEPS
member.summary: The localized FB_WIKI_IMPORT_CONFLUENCE_STEPS string array: ["Backup your Confluence site to a zipped XML file. Make sure to backup attachments, as well. Save the ZIP archive somewhere you can find it.", "Run the Confluence Importer tool.", "Navigate to the ZIP file and open it", "Enter your FogBugz login information and URL", "If you have a proxy, enter it in the following format: proxy.domain.net:8080", "Click ""Import from Confluence"". The import will be done shortly. If an error prevents the import from succeeding, you must delete the Wikis that were created and restart the import process from step 2."]

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_WIKI_IMPORT_DOWNLOAD_CONFLUENCE
member.summary: The FB_WIKI_IMPORT_DOWNLOAD_CONFLUENCE string: "[Download] the Confluence Importer jarfile for Java"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_WIKI_IMPORT_HEAD
member.summary: The FB_WIKI_IMPORT_HEAD string: "Wiki Importers"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_WIKI_IMPORT_HOW_TO_RUN_CONFLUENCE
member.summary: The FB_WIKI_IMPORT_HOW_TO_RUN_CONFLUENCE string: "How to run the Confluence importer"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_WIKI_IMPORT_MEDIAWIKI
member.summary: The FB_WIKI_IMPORT_MEDIAWIKI string: "MediaWiki"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_WIKI_IMPORT_MEDIAWIKI_INSTRUCTIONS
member.summary: The FB_WIKI_IMPORT_MEDIAWIKI_INSTRUCTIONS string: "[Download] the MediaWiki Importer .tar.gz. Extract it, and follow the README.txt inside. Titles that are just numbers, such as 1994, will have square brackets put around their name: [1994]. Titles are not case-sensitive in FogBugz, so if two articles are identically named except for case, the importer will rename one to have a |2, |3, etc. after it. Colons in MediaWiki titles will be changed to the pipe character ( | ) in FogBugz. Your MediaWiki installation needs to be version 1.11 or higher."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_WIKI_IMPORT_SUMMARY
member.summary: The FB_WIKI_IMPORT_SUMMARY string: "FogBugz can import your wikis with their revision history, images, and attachments intact from other wiki systems."

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_WIKI_IMPORT_WHAT_TO_EXPECT
member.summary: The FB_WIKI_IMPORT_WHAT_TO_EXPECT string: "What to expect"

member.name: P:FogCreek.FogBugz.Globalization.CLocalizer.FB_WIKI_IMPORT_WHAT_TO_EXPECT_BODY
member.summary: The localized FB_WIKI_IMPORT_WHAT_TO_EXPECT_BODY string array: ["The Confluence importer will not import a Space over top of a FogBugz Wiki. For example, if you have a Wiki named ""Documentation"" already in FogBugz, and try to import a Confluence Space named ""Documentation"" as well, the importer will not replace the existing wiki in FogBugz, and the import might not work as expected.", "All attachments associated with Wiki pages will be uploaded; however, they might not have an explicit link associated with them.", "Old revisions of Wiki pages will be imported, but all revisions will show their creator as the user you logged into FogBugz as.", "You must log in as an administrator to use the importer, because it requires permission to create Wikis.", "The following information will be discarded: drafts, blogs, mail, labels (These will be handled by the Confluence importer at a later date), permissions, anchors (intra-page links), most Confluence macros, and page hierarchy (children/parents)"]

The FB_WORKING_SCHEDULE_INSTRUCTIONS_SITE string: "

Enter your site-wide working schedule and holidays. This is used to calculate completion dates and due dates, and to convert estimates between hours and days. FogBugz users can also enter their own working schedules if they differ.

Most values you enter on this page will be used as the default for new users. Changing them will not affect existing users.

"

member.name: M:FogCreek.FogBugz.Plugins.Api.CDatabaseUpgradeApi.ChangeColumnDefinition(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Change the definition of a column, by creating a temporary column, copying the data into it, deleting the old column, creating the column with the new definition, and copying the data from the temporary column into the new column. Note that changing the datatype of a column will only work when changing from a smaller type to a larger type with the same kind of data (e.g. conversion from varchar(10) to varchar(50) or text, or conversion from tinyint to int). Changing a default value or adding/removing a NOT NULL constraint should always work.
member.param: The name of the table containing the new definition of the column to change.
The name of the column to change.

member.name: M:FogCreek.FogBugz.Plugins.Api.CDatabaseUpgradeApi.DropColumn(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Drop a column from a database table, if it exists.

member.returns: True if the column was dropped.

member.summary: Drop an index frrom a database table, if it exists.

The name of the index to drop.
member.returns: True if the column was dropped.

member.name: T:FogCreek.FogBugz.Plugins.Api.CLockApi
member.summary: An API for database-level locking

member.name: M:FogCreek.FogBugz.Plugins.Api.CLockApi.GetLock(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Gets a lock on the database
member.param: The name of the lock
The number of seconds after which we should declare a lock stale and break it
ref parameter that will be set to true if we had to break the lock
member.returns: If locking was successful, the string is the key. If not, then it's the empty string.

member.name: M:FogCreek.FogBugz.Plugins.Api.CLockApi.GetLock(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a lock on the database
member.param: The name of the lock
The number of seconds after which we should declare a lock stale and break it
ref parameter that will be set to true if we had to break the lock
takes the lock by force -- that is, we don't wait for the current lock to expire
member.returns: If locking was successful, the string is the key. If not, then it's the empty string.

member.name: M:FogCreek.FogBugz.Plugins.Api.CLockApi.GetLockOrSpin(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Attempts to get a lock for up to cSecondsSpin seconds before giving up.
member.param: The name of the lock
The number of seconds after which we should declare a lock stale and break it
ref parameter that will be set to true if we had to break the lock
How long to spin
member.returns: If locking was successful, the string is the key. If not, then it's the empty string.

member.name: M:FogCreek.FogBugz.Plugins.Api.CLockApi.ReleaseLock(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Unlock a lock

member.name: M:FogCreek.FogBugz.Plugins.Interfaces.IPluginGridColumn.GridColumnSortQuery(FogCreek.FogBugz.Plugins.Entity.CGridColumn,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the SELECT query for sorting by this grid column. If fIncludeSelect is true, the query must SELECT all fields in the ORDER BY portion of the query (a requirement of certain types of sort queries). For example, "SELECT (hrsEstimated - hrsElapsed) AS hrsRemaining ... ORDER BY (hrsEstimated - hrsElapsed).
member.param: The grid column being sorted.
True if the column should be sorted descending, False if ascending.
True if the query must SELECT all fields in the ORDER BY portion of the query.
member.returns: The SELECT query to execute to sort by this column.

member.name: T:FogCreek.FogBugz.Plugins.Interfaces.IPluginStaticCSS
member.summary: Interface for adding static css files to be included.

member.name: M:FogCreek.FogBugz.Plugins.Interfaces.IPluginStaticCSS.StaticCSSFiles
member.summary: Get the list of files to send down. Each file must be located in the \static\ subdirectory of this plugin. This interface should be used only for static files. The files will be sent with a long expiration, so they cannot be changed on a per-page basis. A change in plugin version will reset the cache.
member.returns: The list of files to include, relative to the \static\ folder. "\static\css\plugin.css" should be returned as "css\plugin.css".

member.name: T:FogCreek.FogBugz.Plugins.Interfaces.IPluginStaticFile

member.summary: Determines the visibility of the file. Users at the visibility level or above will be able to view the page (e.g. PermissionLevel.Community includes Administrators, Normal and Community users, but excludes Public users).
member.param: The name of the file.
member.returns: The minimum required visibility to view the page.

member.summary: Get the HTML to insert into the document, replacing the selected text. This method is not called until WysiwygContextMenuDialogDisplay returns null.
